div.p: I am here after 2 days hard colley in the stage and will be off in the morning to Cincinnilte; by Cleaveland &New York & Washington

I asked John Martin to help me get lead of line, who is a disavantage to our children. The had better stay in Nashville looking out for a place, during what time you can have a as to her, until you hear from me, after I hear lear Gersodt. Pcihefs he can find a place for her or will ossest her to Germany.

It is a great afflection to me to expecate from you other children, and leave so heavy a wfd ability as the management of the farm in your hands, but I is my duty to bear it for the sake of the ultimate advantage which may come from my success. You must meet your share of the difficulty with your whole fortitude. In a short time I shall understand my ground, and the moment I see that the profits of the enterprise will authorize me to take a house at Washington, I shall come on for you. Let my letters be sent on to Washington and particularly the quarterly of the French reviews forwarded to me by my con Jackson. If Otter come from
the winter in Mississippi send them to me.
Should you get sick it the children telegraph me
With my prayer for your health & happiness and that of our dear children I remain always
